timeline.title: New Mechanisms Introduced into the Education Process

firstslide.title: Two-Tier Higher Education System
firstslide.text: Based on the Presidential Decree of the Republic of Uzbekistan dated April 15, 2021, Decree No. PQ-5076 ‘On Measures to Introduce a Qualitatively New System for Training Professional Personnel for Internal Affairs Agencies,’ a two-tier higher education system, including bachelor's and master's degrees, compliant with global standards, has been implemented from the 2021/2022 academic year.

secondslide.title: Pedagogical Certification
secondslide.text: To update the composition of the teaching staff according to modern requirements, a pedagogical certification was held from June 3 to July 8, 2021. As a result, 131 out of 260 professors and lecturers (50.4%) were removed from their positions.

thirdslide.title: Modular Training System
thirdslide.text: To enhance the integration of theory and practice and ensure the quick adaptation of graduates to practice, a modular training system has been introduced. Under this system, daytime undergraduate studies include 3 weeks of theoretical training and 1 week of basic practice, with 60% of classes focused on theory and 40% on practice (previously 80% theory and 20% practice).

fourthslide.title: Complex Training Exercises
fourthslide.text: ‘Final’ complex training exercises are being conducted. In these exercises, cadets are divided into rapid response groups to develop practical skills in crime detection, conducting investigations, and preventing violations (each module ends with a ‘mini-final,’ and graduation courses conclude with ‘Final’ complex training exercises).

fifthslide.title: Basic Practical Training
fifthslide.text: Basic practical training involves cadets consolidating theoretical knowledge at practice sites, such as internal affairs departments in Yunusabad, Yashnabad, Mirzo-Ulugbek, and Mirobod districts, and neighborhood law-enforcement centers. This includes developing skills for making independent, correct, and rapid decisions in non-standard situations (in 2021-2024, 4338 sessions were held at these sites).

sixthslide.title: Quarterly Reporting Meetings
sixthslide.text: The participation of department heads in quarterly reporting meetings of the Ministry of Internal Affairs sectoral services has been established. This mechanism ensures the educational process is informed with necessary data, helps to identify issues arising in practice, and strengthens cadets’ knowledge and skills based on this information (50 meetings were held in 2021-2024).

seventhslide.title: Establishment of ‘Muloqot’ Clubs
seventhslide.text: ‘Muloqot’ clubs have been established to enable cadets to learn from experienced staff and veterans about the investigation and disclosure of ‘high-profile’ crimes based on long-term practical experience (156 events were organized in 2021-2024).

eighthslide.title: Online Master Classes
eighthslide.text: To study the criminogenic situation in regions and the experience of combating crime, as well as to analyze problems in crime prevention, online master classes are conducted by the leaders of territorial internal affairs agencies. These sessions are aimed at developing cadets' skills for rapid adaptation to future service activities (322 master classes have been conducted from 2021 to 2024).

ninethslide.title: Activities of Training Investigative-Operational Groups
ninethslide.text: Groups consisting of professors, lecturers, and cadets are dispatched to crime scenes to conduct preliminary investigative actions and enhance practical skills (2378 crime scene investigations were conducted in Tashkent from 2021 to 2024).

tenthslide.title: New Faculties
tenthslide.text: To effectively manage the educational and scientific activities of departments and to ensure the high-quality implementation of educational programs, four new faculties have been established. These faculties integrate specialized departments by undergraduate directions and other departments based on their content.

eleventhslide.title: Field Court Sessions
eleventhslide.text: Participation of cadets in court sessions has been organized to develop practical skills in qualifying offenses and legal evaluation (127 court sessions have been organized from 2021 to 2024).

twelfthslide.title: Involvement of Experienced Practical Staff
twelfthslide.text: To ensure the direct integration of the educational process with practice and to effectively utilize the experience of practical staff, experienced employees from structural and territorial units of the Ministry of Internal Affairs are engaged on an hourly basis (1156 sessions have been conducted from 2021 to 2024).

thirteenthslide.title: Daily Internship of Graduating Cadets as Interns
thirteenthslide.text: To strengthen practical skills in applying theoretical knowledge, graduating cadets with high academic performance are sent for daily internships in internal affairs agencies as interns according to their specialization.

fourteenthslide.title: Center for Quality Control and Monitoring of Education
fourteenthslide.text: The goal is to ensure that the knowledge of cadets (listeners) meets state educational standards, conduct analysis, monitor the quality of personnel training, organize internal certification, and identify factors negatively affecting the quality of education and take measures to address them.

fifteenthslide.title: Center for Methodological Support
fifteenthslide.text: A Center for Methodological Support of the Activities of Internal Affairs Agencies has been established at the Academy, which has improved the methodological support for practical organs.

sixteenthslide.title: Establishment of a Center for Retraining and Professional Development of Driving School Staff
sixteenthslide.text: During the past period, 7821 teachers and driving instructors (teachers – 2345, driving instructors – 5476) have undergone retraining.

seventeenthslide.title: Specialty ‘Scientific-Pedagogical Activity’
seventeenthslide.text: Starting from the 2024/2025 academic year, a specialty ‘Scientific-Pedagogical Activity’ will be introduced in the Master's program, aimed at preparing qualified scientific-pedagogical staff for educational institutions.

eighteenthslide.title: Retraining and Professional Development of Pedagogical Staff
eighteenthslide.text: The Academy has been granted the right to retrain and improve the qualifications of pedagogical staff of educational institutions of internal affairs agencies. A Center for Retraining and Professional Development of Pedagogical Staff has been established (this year, 18 pedagogical staff have undergone retraining).

nineteenthslide.title: Improvement of the Personnel Training and Education System
nineteenthslide.text: A Faculty for Working with Foreign Personnel has been established at the Academy, and starting from the 2024/2025 academic year, a system for training and educating personnel for internal affairs (police) from foreign countries will be implemented.
